title: Renpet
text: Renpet was, in the <a href="Egyptian%20language">Egyptian language</a>, the word for "year". Its hieroglyph was figuratively depicted in <a href="art">art</a> as a woman wearing a <a href="Palm%20tree">palm</a> shoot (symbolizing <a href="time">time</a>) over her head. She was often referred to as the "Mistress of <a href="Eternity">Eternity</a>" and also personified fertility, youth and <a href="spring%20%28season%29">spring</a>. The glyph regularly appears on monuments and documents throughout Egyptian history as the beginning of the phrase recording the regnal year of the pharaoh.
